name: Parasnath Hill
description: Elevation 1,365m, in Giridih district. Famous Jain pilgrimage site with panoramic views and serene trekking trails.
history: Parasnath has been a key Jain pilgrimage site for centuries, attracting devotees from across India.
culturalOverview: Thousands of Jain pilgrims visit during festivals. Local tribes also regard it as sacred.
importance: Religious tourism, trekking, and biodiversity hotspot.
thingsToCarry: Trekking gear, water, camera, comfortable shoes
speciality: Combination of Jain pilgrimage and trekking through forest.

name: Netarhat
description: Known as 'Queen of Chotanagpur', 1,128m high. Popular for sunrise/sunset points and lush landscapes.
history: Netarhat was developed during the British era as a hill station and educational hub.
culturalOverview: Popular among locals and tourists for cultural events and trekking.

name: Baidyanath Hill
description: Deoghar district, elevation around 400m. Famous for Baidyanath Dham temple, a major pilgrimage site and serene hill with scenic views.
history: Baidyanath Dham is one of the 12 Jyotirlingas of Lord Shiva, over 1000 years old.
culturalOverview: Hosts large pilgrimages, especially during Shravan month.
importance: Religious tourism and local cultural heritage.
thingsToCarry: Water, modest clothing, camera, sun protection

name: Tagore Hill
description: Ranchi city viewpoint at moderate elevation. Historical spot linked to Tagore family, ideal for picnics.
history: Named after the Tagore family; historically significant viewpoint.
culturalOverview: Used for picnics and local cultural gatherings.

name: Trikut Hill
description: Deoghar's three peaks, 370m approx. Great for trekking and pilgrimage with stunning surroundings.
history: Known for its three distinct peaks and religious sites nearby.
culturalOverview: Trekking festivals and local pilgrimages occur annually.

name: Dalma Hills
description: Elevation 915m, East Singhbhum. Known for wildlife sanctuary and scenic trekking routes.
history: Dalma Hills is historically inhabited by local tribes and known for its biodiversity.
culturalOverview: Tribal culture and eco-tourism are prominent in this area.

name: Rajmahal Hills
description: Located in Sahibganj, ancient volcanic hills. Offers geological wonders and scenic landscapes.
history: Geologically significant volcanic hills with historic settlements.
culturalOverview: Local tribes have unique cultural practices tied to these hills.
speciality: Ancient volcanic formations and scenic landscapes.

name: Garhjat Hills
description: Bordering Jharkhand, moderate elevation. Rich in minerals, ideal for trekking and nature lovers.
history: Historically mined for minerals and home to tribal settlements.
culturalOverview: Local tribal culture and trekking activities are popular.
importance: Mining history, trekking, and nature tourism.
